name: Tooth and Nail
text:
Choose one —
• Search your library for up to two creature cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
• Put up to two creature cards from your hand onto the battlefield.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

name: Tooth, Claw, and Tail
text: When you set this scheme in motion, destroy up to three target nonland permanents.

editions.flavor: "Silence your wailing. This is but a taste of the destruction my pets have in store."

name: Tooth Collector
text:
When Tooth Collector enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, target creature that player controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

name: Tooth of Chiss-Goria
text:
Flash
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Tooth of Ramos
text:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Sacrifice Tooth of Ramos: Add {W} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Ramos smiled, and there was day.

name: Topan Ascetic
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Topan Ascetic gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Monks from Topa wander all of Bant, encouraging the Unbeholden to find their place in society through honorable combat.

name: Topan Freeblade
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

editions.flavor: "My scars are my sigils. I will wear them with pride long after you're gone."

name: Topple
text: Exile target creature with the greatest power among creatures on the battlefield. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target any one of them.)

editions.flavor:
"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax

name: Topplegeist
text:
Flying
When Topplegeist enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, tap target creature that player controls.

name: Topsy Turvy
text:
The phases of each player's turn are reversed. (The phases are, in reverse order, end, postcombat main, combat, precombat main, and beginning.)
If there are more than two players in the game, the turn order is reversed.

editions.flavor: "Here on going is heck the what?"

name: Torch Drake
text:
Flying
{1}{R}: Torch Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Drakes? Bah! Things that breathe don't interest me. It breathes fire, you say? Well, that's a different story!"
—Zataz, Izzet clockwork artificer

name: Torch Fiend
text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.
Devils redecorate every room with fire.
Devils redecorate every room with fire.
Devils redecorate every room with fire.

name: Torch Gauntlet
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

editions.flavor:
"Good morning, children. Please open your aether valves and ignite your gauntlets."
—Rakib, Ghirapur schoolteacher

name: Torchling
text:
{R}: Untap Torchling.
{R}: Target creature blocks Torchling this turn if able.
{R}: Change the target of target spell that targets only Torchling.
{1}: Torchling gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}: Torchling gets -1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Torch Slinger
text:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Torch Slinger enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: Once thrown, twice burned.
Once thrown, twice burned.

name: Torch Song
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a verse counter on Torch Song.
{2}{R}, Sacrifice Torch Song: Torch Song deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of verse counters on Torch Song.

editions.flavor:
"What do you do then? Run. Run very fast. Don't stop until you see the camp—or a bigger Giant."
—Toothlicker Harj,
Orcish Captain

name: Torii Watchward
text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Torment
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.

editions.flavor:
"Volrath has killed me. All that remains of me is the scar!"
—Tahngarth

name: Tormented Angel
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Falling from heaven is not as painful as surviving the impact.

name: Tormented Hero
text:
Tormented Hero enters the battlefield tapped.
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Tormented Hero, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

name: Tormented Pariah
text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.

editions.flavor: "Hey lads, the moon's rising. All the better to watch him beg for mercy."

name: Tormented Soul
text: Tormented Soul can't block and can't be blocked.

editions.flavor: Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.
Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.
Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.
Those who raged most bitterly at the world in life are cursed to roam the nether realms in death.

name: Tormented Thoughts
text:
As an additional cost to cast Tormented Thoughts, sacrifice a creature.
Target player discards a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

editions.flavor:
"Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver
"Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."—Ashiok

name: Tormenting Voice
text:
As an additional cost to cast Tormenting Voice, discard a card.
Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: A mocking laughter echoed in Ugin's mind. How many centuries had he slumbered, stricken, while Nicol Bolas moved unchallenged among the planes?

"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol

"The voice has grown louder, its accusations angrier and more insistent. By morning, it will likely drown out all else. I fear what I will do."
—Letter discovered in an abandoned estate

"Unwelcome thoughts crowd my mind. Are they my own madness, or the whispers of another?"
—Sarkhan Vol

name: Tormentor Exarch
text:
When Tormentor Exarch enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature gets -0/-2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Tend the molten slag, or be the molten slag."
—Urabrask's enforcer

name: Tormentor's Trident
text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and attacks each turn if able.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor: To a demon there is no such thing as restraint.

name: Tormod's Crypt
text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

editions.flavor: Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.
The dark opening seemed to breathe the cold, damp air of the dead earth in a steady rhythm.
Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.

Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.

name: Tornado
text:
Cumulative upkeep {G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{2}{G}, Pay 3 life for each velocity counter on Tornado: Destroy target permanent and put a velocity counter on Tornado. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Tornado Elemental
text:
When Tornado Elemental enters the battlefield, it deals 6 damage to each creature with flying.
You may have Tornado Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

name: Torpid Moloch
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice three lands: Torpid Moloch loses defender until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Market hucksters sell molochs for use as watchdogs. Of course, that's all molochs do. Sit around . . . and watch.

name: Torpor Dust
text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.

editions.flavor: "Some folk these days are too restless to dream the dreams we need. We need to teach them to stop and catch their breath."

name: Torpor Orb
text: Creatures entering the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.

editions.flavor:
"Phyrexia is certainly dangerous, but I have to admire some of its innovations."
—Tezzeret

name: Torrent Elemental
text:
Flying
Whenever Torrent Elemental attacks, tap all creatures defending player controls.
{3}{B/G}{B/G}: Put Torrent Elemental from exile onto the battlefield tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Torrential Gearhulk
text:
Flash
When Torrential Gearhulk enters the battlefield, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that card would be put into your graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

name: Torrent of Fire
text: Torrent of Fire deals damage equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Dragon fire melts any instrument designed to measure it.

name: Torrent of Lava
text:
Torrent of Lava deals X damage to each creature without flying.
As long as Torrent of Lava is on the stack, each creature has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to this creature by Torrent of Lava this turn."

editions.flavor: The mountain's voice shouts us all down.

name: Torrent of Souls
text: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. (Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)

name: Torrent of Stone
text:
Torrent of Stone deals 4 damage to target creature.
Splice onto Arcane—Sacrifice two Mountains. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

editions.flavor: "How can you accuse me of evil? Though these deeds be unsavory, no one will argue: good shall follow from them."
"How can you accuse me of evil? Though these deeds be unsavory, no one will argue: good shall follow from them."

name: Tortoise Formation
text: Creatures you control gain shroud until end of turn. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: At sea, the Jhessian fleet strikes swiftly and decisively. On land, facing the elite cavalry of Valeron, its marines must rely on more cautious strategies.

name: Torture
text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.

editions.flavor:
"Oh, they scream, right enough, and plead, too—but the Baron keeps no mercy in his vault of horrors."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

"It helps you pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

"It helps pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir
What the vigor of life builds up, agony tears down again.

name: Torture Chamber
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a pain counter on Torture Chamber.
At the beginning of your end step, Torture Chamber deals damage to you equal to the number of pain counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove all pain counters from Torture Chamber: Torture Chamber deals damage to target creature equal to the number of pain counters removed this way.

name: Tortured Existence
text: {B}, Discard a creature card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"There are terrors lurking in the unseen corners of us all."
—Crovax

name: Tor Wauki
text: {T}: Tor Wauki deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

name: Toshiro Umezawa
text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may cast target instant card from your graveyard. If that card would be put into a graveyard this turn, exile it instead.

name: Totally Lost
text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor: Fblthp had always hated crowds.

name: Total War
text: Whenever a player attacks with one or more creatures, destroy all untapped non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack, except for creatures the player hasn't controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn.

name: Totem-Guide Hartebeest
text: When Totem-Guide Hartebeest enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: It is hunted, but not for the kill. The magic within draws others to its presence.
The kor track hartebeests in hopes of finding magic to help fight the Eldrazi.

name: Totem Speaker
text: Whenever a Beast enters the battlefield, you may gain 3 life.

editions.flavor: "Elves and beasts are tied together, and I am the knot that binds them."

name: To the Slaughter
text:
Target player sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
Delirium — If there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, instead that player sacrifices a creature and a planeswalker.

editions.flavor:
"Where has little Gossamer gone?"
—Thaniel, Gatstaf shepherd

name: Touch and Go
text:
Destroy target land.
Gotcha Whenever an opponent touches his or her face, you may say "Gotcha" If you do, return Touch and Go from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: Judge's ruling: The interior of the face still counts as the face, so a nose-pick is legitimate grounds for saying "Gotcha"

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: Draw two cards.

editions.flavor: Acting on one good idea is better than hoarding all the world's knowledge.
"I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."
"I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

name: Touch of Darkness
text: Any number of target creatures become black until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Black spirits and white, red spirits and gray,/ Mingle, mingle, mingle, you that mingle may." —Thomas Middleton, The Witch

name: Touch of Death
text:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

editions.flavor:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Touch of Invisibility
text:
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Cephalids specialize in things unseen, be they politics, betrayal, or themselves.

name: Touch of Moonglove
text: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains deathtouch until end of turn. Whenever a creature dealt damage by that creature dies this turn, its controller loses 2 life. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

name: Touch of the Eternal
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, count the number of permanents you control. Your life total becomes that number.

editions.flavor:
"Time is a vigilant tyrant, but there are those who have broken free of its gaze."
—Laikas, Erunian monk

name: Touch of the Void
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Touch of the Void deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.

editions.flavor: Some wounds never heal.

name: Touch of Vitae
text:
Until end of turn, target creature gains haste and "{0}: Untap this creature. Activate this ability only once."
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Touchstone
text: {T}: Tap target artifact you don't control.

editions.flavor:
"One touch to the stone and the sidar's son turned me from stalwart to statue."
—Karn, silver golem

name: Tourach's Chant
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Tourach's Chant unless you pay {B}.
Whenever a player puts a Forest onto the battlefield, Tourach's Chant deals 3 damage to that player unless he or she puts a -1/-1 counter on a creature he or she controls.

name: Tourach's Gate
text:
Enchant land you control
Sacrifice a Thrull: Put three time counters on Tourach's Gate.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from Tourach's Gate. If there are no time counters on Tourach's Gate, sacrifice it.
Tap enchanted land: Attacking creatures you control get +2/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted land is untapped.

name: Tovolar's Magehunter
text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Tovolar's Magehunter deals 2 damage to that player.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Tovolar's Magehunter.

name: Tower Above
text:
({2/G} can be paid with any two mana or with {G}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)
Until end of turn, target creature gets +4/+4 and gains trample, wither, and "When this creature attacks, target creature blocks it this turn if able." (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

name: Tower Defense
text: Creatures you control get +0/+5 and gain reach until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The drakes are practice. We may one day need to bring down a sky swallower, or maybe even Rakdos himself."
—Korun Nar, Rubblebelt hunter

name: Tower Drake
text:
Flying
{W}: Tower Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Young tower drakes quickly learn to maneuver among Benalia's many spires.
The first motion put forth in the pristine Jelenn Column was for severe restrictions on the airspace around New Prahv.

name: Tower Gargoyle
text: Flying

editions.flavor:
"Esper, like any work of art, can be truly appreciated only from a distance."
—Tezzeret

"Esper, like any work of art, can be truly appreciated only from a distance."
—Tezzeret

name: Tower Geist
text:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.

name: Towering Baloth
text: Morph {6}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

editions.flavor: The Mirari twisted all that lived in the Krosan Forest into gross mockeries of their former selves.

name: Towering Indrik
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

editions.flavor: It chases its airborne prey relentlessly, heedless to what it pulverizes beneath its hooves.

name: Towering Thunderfist
text: {W}: Towering Thunderfist gains vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Nothing ruins a party like one of those big killjoys bursting through the door and setting all the guests free."
—Ruba, Rakdos cultist

name: Tower of Calamities
text: {8}, {T}: Tower of Calamities deals 12 damage to target creature.

editions.flavor: The ur-golems concealed one of their towers out of fear that its power would be abused, and in anticipation of a time when its power would be sorely needed.

name: Tower of Champions
text: {8}, {T}: Target creature gets +6/+6 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The ur-golem runes tell of the transformation of Mirrodin's warden from silent guardian to merciless god.

name: Tower of Coireall
text: {T}: Target creature can't be blocked by Walls this turn.

name: Tower of Eons
text: {8}, {T}: You gain 10 life.

editions.flavor: Its etchings tell the ur-golems' stories of an entity able to force life into a lifeless plane.

name: Tower of Fortunes
text: {8}, {T}: Draw four cards.

editions.flavor: The ur-golem etchings begin by celebrating Mirrodin's creator, a golem of almost limitless power. They end by cursing its protector, a being called Memnarch.
The ur-golem etchings begin by celebrating Mirrodin's creator, a golem of almost limitless power. They end by cursing its protector, a being called Memnarch.

name: Tower of Murmurs
text: {8}, {T}: Target player puts the top eight cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Etched on its surface are warnings from a long-lost race of ur-golems pushed to the brink of extinction.

name: Tower of the Magistrate
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from artifacts until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Like the city, weakest at its foundation.

name: Town Gossipmonger
text: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Transform Town Gossipmonger.

editions.flavor: "You'll never believe what I heard."

name: Town Sentry
text: Whenever Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"So he gots a sword. Big deal."
"Yeah, it's a big deal—it's a big sword!"
—Two goblins outside the gates of Trokin

name: Toxic Deluge
text:
As an additional cost to cast Toxic Deluge, pay X life.
All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"It's a difficult task to quarantine a plague that moves with the clouds."
—Esara, healer adept

"It's a difficult task to quarantine a plague that moves with the clouds."
—Esara, healer adept

name: Toxic Iguanar
text: Toxic Iguanar has deathtouch as long as you control a green permanent. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

editions.flavor: There are no "weak" creatures on Jund. Even the smallest can strike a deadly blow.

name: Toxic Nim
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{B}: Regenerate Toxic Nim.

editions.flavor: The nim have become roving killers marshaled by whichever thane holds tenuous leadership.

name: Toxic Stench
text:
Target nonblack creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Threshold — If seven or more cards are in your graveyard, instead destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Toxin Sliver
text: Whenever a Sliver deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor: It doesn't need to use its venom—it just needs you to know it can.

name: Toy Boat
text: Cumulative upkeep—Say "Toy Boat" quickly. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on Toy Boat, then sacrifice it unless you say "Toy Boat" once for each age counter on it—without pausing between or fumbling it.)

name: Toymaker
text: {1}, {T}, Discard a card: Target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost until end of turn. (It retains its abilities.)

name: Trace of Abundance
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Tracker
text: {G}{G}, {T}: Tracker deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to Tracker.

name: Tracker's Instincts
text:
Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put a creature card from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

name: Trade Caravan
text:

Remove two currency counters from Trade Caravan: Untap target basic land. Activate this ability only during an opponent's upkeep.

name: Trade Routes
text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.
Like the price of goods, the value of the routes was renegotiated daily.
The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.

text: Target opponent draws two cards, then you draw up to four cards. That opponent may repeat this process as many times as he or she chooses.

name: Tradewind Rider
text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.
It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

The spear thrown by Kytheon's own hand was the weapon that felled his friends.
